The two outputs should be the same except that the rk4 will group the same ordered derivatives in [].
The problem is arrising in the addition going on in rk4 > k_mat(), specifically the line:
	temp_s[m][n] = state[m][n]+dh_mat[m][n]
This seems pretty straightforward, and appears to be doing the same thing that rk4_two_bodies > k()
is doing. Take a closer look later.

rk4_two_bodies

('dh1: ', [0, 0, 0, 0]) g
('k1: ', (0.0, 0.0, 0.20580000000000007, -0.15141000000000004)) g
('dh2: ', [0.0, 0.0, 0.10290000000000003, -0.07570500000000002]) g 
('k2: ', (0.0, 0.0, 0.20533346299412292, -0.1512077143829028)) <-- dh_ij > 0, k+dh deviates from rk4
('dh3: ', [0.0, 0.0, 0.10266673149706146, -0.0756038571914514])
('k3: ', (0.0, 0.0, 0.20533557396661273, -0.15120825437611907))
('dh4: ', [0.0, 0.0, 0.20533557396661273, -0.15120825437611907])
('k4: ', (0.0, 0.0, 0.20394714886839452, -0.1506043026269949))


rk4

('dh1: ', [[0, 0], [0, 0]]) g
('k1: ', [[0.0, 0.0], [0.20580000000000007, -0.15141000000000004]]) g
('dh2: ', [[0.0, 0.0], [0.10290000000000003, -0.07570500000000002]])g
('k2: ', [[0.0, 0.0], [0.20533346299412292, -0.15138375758885414]])
('dh3: ', [[0.0, 0.0], [0.10266673149706146, -0.07569187879442707]])
('k3: ', [[0.0010290000000000004, -0.0007570500000000002], [0.2050554615667721, -0.15130526397071056]])
('dh4: ', [[0.0010290000000000004, -0.0007570500000000002], [0.2050554615667721, -0.15130526397071056]])
('k4: ', [[0.0020556673149706153, -0.001513968787944271], [0.20283908550355073, -0.1509885536303417]])
